intro: Hexadesmia bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned hexadesmia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two horn-like structures on its calyx. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lanceolate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, with two lobes that resemble horns, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed sites.
